alert.note: Alert for Garrett (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 26 at 7:59PM EST until January 27 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations around 2 to 4 inches with a storm total accumulation around 4 to 8 inches. The highest amounts are most likely along along the western slopes west of Backbone Ridge. Total snowfall accumulation around 1 to 3 inches east of Backbone Ridge. Westerly winds will gust around 30 to 40 mph. * WHERE...Garrett County. * WHEN...Until 4 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Visibility will be reduced to around one- quarter mile or less at times in bands of heavy snow and blowing snow.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
